defensively, and wear

licensed driver and a

vehicle will wear the

values: Brief crews on procedures during limited visibility conditions.
Soldiers will use NODs, DVEs, and RWS FLIR during limited visibility and night time operations.
White light will be use when conducting admin moves.
Ground guides will be used during times of degraded visibility.
PCCs and PCIs Brief limited visibility conditions during safety brief.
RSO/OIC Crews Safeties
Reduce vehicle speed based on road condition
Use of ground guides and chem lights during poor visibility due to weather.
If lightning is in the immediate area all personnel will move to the nearest grounded hard stand structure or spread out in low ground away from all equipment.
Brief inclement weather condition and safety measures during safety brief
RSO/OIC Safeties Crews
Brief all Soldiers on procedure when finding a UXO.
Clear the area surrounding the UXO.
Mark UXO, call EOD and Range Operations.
Safety Brief
RSO/OIC All Soldiers
Platoon Medic will be on-site with his aid bag
Water will be available on the vehicles
PLT Leadership will control work hours and effort in accordance with the weather.
Checks on soldiers condition Water station near the vehicles.
Medic PL, PSG, SLs, TLs

draw.overall_supervision_plan: The PL and PSG will ensure all control measures are in place for safe training. However, team leaders, squad leaders, and VCs have the responsibility to be actively engaged in patrolling lanes and Soldier actions so as to mitigate risk at the lowest level possible and ensure overall safety for the training event.
